meanings.definition: To argue or raise objections about a trivial matter.
meanings.sent1: She kept stickling about the color of the curtains, even though it didn't really matter.
meanings.sent2: He always stickles over the smallest details, making it hard to get anything done.
meanings.sent3: The stickling over who should take out the trash became a never-ending debate.
meanings.sent4: Her constant stickling turned a simple decision into a major disagreement.
meanings.sent5: The stickling over where to go for lunch was more exhausting than the meal itself.

meanings.definition: A person who is overly concerned with minor details.
meanings.sent1: The stickling in the group always points out every little mistake.
meanings.sent2: She's such a stickling when it comes to following the rules.
meanings.sent3: The stickling's attention to detail saved the project from disaster.
meanings.sent4: Being a stickling can be helpful, but it can also be annoying to others.
meanings.sent5: The stickling's meticulous nature made them the perfect candidate for the job.

meanings.definition: A small, thin piece of wood or other material used for stirring or mixing.
meanings.sent1: He grabbed a stickling to mix the paint before starting the project.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for a stickling of cinnamon to be added to the batter.
meanings.sent3: She playfully flicked a stickling at her friend during the cooking class.
meanings.sent4: The stickling danced in the pot as she stirred the soup on the stove.
meanings.sent5: The stickling of glue held the pieces together firmly.
